column2: What the hell is that?!! (to Monica) What the hell is that? Is\nthat you? (Monica nods her head no, and Rachel realizes what is making that sound.)\nOhhhhhhh! (storms over to Chandler and Joey\xc2\x92s with Monica in trail.) '
Boy, you are really not a morning person.'
(angrily) BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get\nup! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!'
What is that noise?'
You!'
It\xc2\x92s the chick! She\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85going through some changes.'
What kind of changes?'
Well the vet seems to think that\xc2\x92s she\xc2\x92s becoming a rooster.\n(The rooster crows.) We\xc2\x92re getting a second opinion.'
Hey!'
Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?'
Well, I\xc2\x92ve been up since six. Thanks to somebody\xc2\x92s\ndumb-ass rooster.'
You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn\xc2\x92t\nbe living in an apartment.'
Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around\xc2\x85'
All right. I\xc2\x92m gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if\nI\xc2\x92m ready to have Frank and Alice\xc2\x92s embryo transferred into my uterus.'
Now, how will they know if you\xc2\x92re ready?'
Oh, they\xc2\x92re just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is\nthick.'
Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.'
Okay everyone, think thick.'
Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)'
Hi! Wish me luck!'
Oh, good luck.'
Good luck. (to Monica) And I\xc2\x92m still right!'
That is sooo not true!'
What?'
She\xc2\x92s mad because I know today\xc2\x92s her laundry day and that means\nshe\xc2\x92s wearing her old lady underpants.'
I can check that for ya.'
I just\xc2\x97I can\xc2\x92t believe that you think that you and Chandler\nknow me and Rachel better than we know you.'
Well\xc2\x85 we-we do. You can only eat Tic Tacks in even\nnumbers.'
Yeah, what\xc2\x92s that about?'
(to Rachel) And you\xc2\x85 Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel\xc2\x92s\nbag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.'
(He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.) You\xc2\x92re good.\n(Tries a cookie.) These are not.'
I\xc2\x92m so not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.'
Yeah.'
Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?'
Five.'
Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.'
How many guesses do you get?'
Six.'
Challenge extended.'
Deal!'
Challenge excepted.'
All right, we\xc2\x92ll start with\xc2\x85apples.'
We\xc2\x92ll be starting with apples.'
(to Ross) Stop that now!'
Yes!'
Okay. Uhh, tortilla chips, yogurt.'
Diet soda.'
Yes. Yes. Yes. (They\xc2\x92re perfect so far.)'
Orange juice.'
No! There\xc2\x92s no orange juice in there! We win!! '
Ha-ha!'
They have another guess.'
Okay, well, we won that one.'
Okay, the last thing\xc2\x85'
Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey\xc2\x92s ear.)'
No-no, not for like another two weeks.'
I got it! Scotch\xc2\x85 tape. (They\xc2\x92re right.)'
How did you know she would buy scotch tape?'
Well, we used there\xc2\x92s up last night making scary faces.'
Aww, man!'
All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme\nit.'
That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.'
Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal\nquestions.'
Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.'
Serious?'
Are you scared?'
No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?'
Ross will do it.'
Oh sure, "Ross will do it!" It\xc2\x92s not like he has a job, or\na child, or a life of his own.'
Fine! We\xc2\x92ll ask Phoebe.'
No-no-no, I-I wanna play.'
It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.'
Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.'
Well, okay, so what\xc2\x92s now\xc2\x97go get, go get the eggs, put \xc2\x91em\nin there.'
Okay, it\xc2\x92ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.'
Embryossss? As in, "More than one?"'
Um-hmm, five actually.'
Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the\nstairs?'
We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will\nattach.'
That\xc2\x92s it! 25 percent? That means that\xc2\x92s it\xc2\x92s like 75\npercent chance of no baby at all!'
Hey, y\xc2\x92know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you\nstuff like 200 of them in there?'
Sweety, now, she\xc2\x92s a woman, not a gumball machine.'
Okay, well y\xc2\x92know what, don\xc2\x92t worry you guys, \xc2\x91cause\nI\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.'
Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot\nto make it right.'
Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we\xc2\x92re kinda\nusing all the money we have to do it just this one time.'

Whoa!! That\xc2\x97okay, that\xc2\x92s a lot of pressure on me and my\nuterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there\xc2\x97is maybe is there something that I\ncan do y\xc2\x92know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?'
No, I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
Wow! You guys really don\xc2\x92t know anything!'
I know! Why don\xc2\x92t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in\nmy high school.'
You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?'
Huh.'
I know! I know, it\xc2\x92s such a huge, life-altering thing.'
I know.'
The test is ready.'
Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)'

Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the
most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History,
Literature, and It\xc2\x92s All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. (He
flips the coin and they all watch it hit the table and stop. Then they all look up at him,
to see who goes first.) Okay, somebody call it this time.'
Oh yeah!'
Tails!'
It\xc2\x92s heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.'
Fears and Pet Peeves.'
What is Monica\xc2\x92s biggest pet peeve?'
Animals dressed as humans.'
That\xc2\x92s correct. Ladies?'
Same category?'
According to Chandler, what phenomenon scares the bejeezus out of him?'
Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!'
That is correct.'
(to Chandler) The Irish gig guy?!'
His legs flail about as if independent of his body!'
Gentlemen, you\xc2\x92re pick.'
It\xc2\x92s All Relative.'
Monica and I have a grandmother who died, you both went to her funeral,\nname that grandmother!'
(to Chandler) Nana?'
She has a real name.'
(answering the question) Althea!'
Althea?! What are you doing?! '
I took a shot.'
You're shooting with Althea?!"
Althea is correct.'
Nice shooting!'
We\xc2\x92ll take Literature!!'
Every week, the TV Guide comes to Chandler and Joey\xc2\x92s apartment. What\nname appears on the address label?'
Chandler gets it! It\xc2\x92s Chandler Bing!'
No!!'
I\xc2\x92m afraid the TV Guide comes to Chinandolor Bong.'
I knew that! Rachel! Use you\xc2\x92re head!'
Actually, it\xc2\x92s Miss Chinandolor Bong.'

Hello, tiny embryos. Well, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m Phoebe Buffay, hi!
I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m hoping to be your uterus for the next nine months. You should
know, that we\xc2\x92re doing this for Frank and Alice, who you know, you\xc2\x92ve been
there! Umm, y\xc2\x92know they want you so much, so when you guys get in there, really grab
on. Okay, and-and I promise that I\xc2\x92ll keep you safe and warm until you\xc2\x92re ready
to have them take you home, so\xc2\x85 Oh! And also, umm next time you see me, I\xc2\x92m
screaming, don\xc2\x92t worry, that\xc2\x92s what\xc2\x92s supposed to happen.'
Ready?'
Uh-huh. (To the embryos) Good luck.'
All right, the score is nine to eight in favor of the guys. Ladies if you\nmiss this the game is theirs, pick your category.'
(shouting) It\xc2\x92s All Relative!!'
You don\xc2\x92t have to shout everything.'
(shouting) I\xc2\x92m sorry!'
Ooh. What is the name of Chandler\xc2\x92s father\xc2\x92s Las Vegas all-male\nburlesque?'
Viva Las Gaygas!'
Unfortunately that is correct.'
Yes!!'
All right, we have a tie. Luckily, I have prepared for such an event. (He\nopens up an envelope and holds up some note cards.) The Lightning Round!'
Ohhhh.'
Thirty seconds, all the questions you can answer.'
You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.'
I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we\xc2\x92re gonna destroy\nyou.'
Huh, wanna bet?'
Well, I\xc2\x92m so confused as to what we\xc2\x92ve been doing so\nfar\xc2\x85'
How about we play for more money, say 150?'
150 dollars.'
200 dollars.'
You\xc2\x92re doing it again.'
Excuse me.'
Monica, I don\xc2\x92t want to lose 200 dollars.'
We won\xc2\x92t. (to Chandler) 300?'
Monica?!'
I\xc2\x92m just trying to spice it up!'
Okay, so let\xc2\x92s play for some pepper! Stop spending my money!'
I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?'
Oooohh that\xc2\x92s interesting.'
Hey, no way, that rooster\xc2\x92s family!'
Throw in the duck too!'
What do you have against the duck?! He doesn\xc2\x92t make any noise!'
Well, he gets the other one all riled up.'
Look, we are not gonna\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) All right, hold on! If you win, we give up the birds.'
(shocked) Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)'
But if we win, we get your apartment.'
Oooooh!'
Deal!'
Monica, betting the apartment, I don\xc2\x92t know about this.'
Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game!\nLook at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)'
Why? Do you have the answers written on there?'
No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.'
All right, let\xc2\x92s do it.'
Come on!'
Okay. (They go into the living room.)'
All right, gentlemen, you\xc2\x92re up first.'
Okay.'
Okay. (Starts jumping around.)'
You have 30 seconds. And the lightning round begins\xc2\x97stop it (Chandler\nstops jumping)\xc2\x97now. What was Monica\xc2\x92s nickname when she was a field hockey\ngoalie?'
Big fat goalie.'
Correct. Rachel claims this is her favorite movie\xc2\x85'
Dangerous Liaisons.'
Correct. Her actual favorite movie is...'
Weekend at Bernie\xc2\x92s.'
Correct. In what part of her body did Monica get a pencil stuck at age 14?'
Oh! (Whispers something in Joey\xc2\x92s ear and then in Ross\xc2\x92s\near.)'
Eww! No!! Her ear! All right, Monica categorizes her towels. How many\ncategories are there?'
Everyday use.'
Fancy.'
Guest.'
Fancy guest.'
Two seconds\xc2\x85'
11, unbelievable 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.) All right,\nthat\xc2\x92s 4 for the guys. Ladies, you\xc2\x92re up. '
All right!'
Come on!'
30 seconds on the clock. 5 questions wins the game. The lightning round\nbegins\xc2\x85now! What is Joey\xc2\x92s favorite food?'
Sandwiches! '
Correct. Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl\xc2\x92s breast?'
Thanks man.'
Joey, had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?'
Maurice.'
Correct, his profession was?'
Space cowboy!'
Correct! What is Chandler Bing\xc2\x92s job?'
Oh gosh, it has something to do with numbers.'
And processing.'
He carries a briefcase.'
10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.'
It\xc2\x92s umm, it has something to do with transponding.'
Oh-oh-oh, he\xc2\x92s a transponce\xc2\x97transpondster!'
That\xc2\x92s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!'
NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!'
Oh my God.'
YEAH!!! YES!!!'
I call Monica\xc2\x92s room!'
You can\xc2\x92t just call Monica\xc2\x92s room.'
Sure I can, standard shotgun rules, I\xc2\x92m sight of the room and I\ncalled it.'
Man, I feel like I\xc2\x92m coming down with something.'
What?'
Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can\xc2\x92t guess what color my tonsils\nare? I\xc2\x92ll bet the apartment!'
Oh, I would never bet this apartment. It\xc2\x92s too nice.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Hey\xc2\x97ooh Pheebs, are they in there?'
Umm, yeah, uh-huh, they\xc2\x92re implanted.'
How do you feel?'
Well, freaked. \xc2\x91Cause it turns out that the odds are really sucky.\nAnd! This is Frank and Alice\xc2\x92s like only shot. Like, they are literally\nputting all of their eggs in my basket.'
Yeah, but I bet it works.'
Really?! How much?!'
All right, I\xc2\x92m gonna go take a pregnancy test, right now.'
Oh wow! You can tell this soon.'
Well the doctor says it takes a couple days, but my body\xc2\x92s always\nbeen a little faster than Western medicine. '
(entering from Chandler\xc2\x92s bedroom, I guess, and sees the foosball\ntable.) Oh my God! I can\xc2\x92t believe you guys are actually think you\xc2\x92re moving in\nhere!'
Well believe it baby!'
Well I-I-I\xc2\x92m not moving.'
What?!'
No, it was a stupid bet! We were just playing a game!'
You can\xc2\x92t just ignore the bet! It\xc2\x92s a bet! You bet and you bet\nand if you lose, you lose the bet!'
Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would\xc2\x92ve\nmade them get rid of the birds. Right?'
Noooo.'
All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel\nbetter, it\xc2\x92s all your fault.'
What?!'
Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!'
I knew it!'
I don\xc2\x92t care, I\xc2\x92m not going anywhere.'
Cool, girl roommate.'
Well?'
Nope, not knocked up yet.'
It\xc2\x92s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.'

Yeah, all right. Meanwhile, I\xc2\x92m gonna do whatever I can to help
this so, I\xc2\x92m just gonna y\xc2\x92know, lie it your chair, (She climbs into the chair
and drapes her feet over the back of the chair.) Y'know? Yeah, good, I\xc2\x92m let gravity
y\xc2\x92know, do its jobs."
Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?'

No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment
and I like it! This is a girl\xc2\x92s apartment! That is a boy\xc2\x92s apartment, it\xc2\x92s
dirty and it smells. This is pretty. It\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s so pretty! And look, and
it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s purple! And I\xc2\x92m telling you, you with the steady hand, I am not
moving, and now I have got the steady hand. (She holds out her hand, which is
shaking uncontrollably.) '
I\xc2\x92ll take care of it.'
That\xc2\x92s right! You do what the hand says!'
How did it go?'
I lost our mattresses.'

(singing) "Are you in there little fetus? 
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
In nine will you come great us? 
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
I will buy you some Adidas."'
Hey!'
(entering) Hi!'
Hi, Phoebe! We were just at the drugstore and we got you a little\npresent.'
Oh. Oh.'
Umm, it\xc2\x92s a lollipop and a uh, a home pregnancy test.'
Hey, don\xc2\x92t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.'
So umm, you feel like taking a test? There\xc2\x92s only one question.'

All right, I will. No, I will. But umm, y\xc2\x92know just remember that
it\xc2\x92s still really early, okay so, if it says that I\xc2\x92m not pregnant, that
doesn\xc2\x92t mean that I\xc2\x92m not gonna get pregnant, okay and, and just please,
just so I don\xc2\x92t go completely nuts, just try not put all your hopes on this.'
Okay.'
Okay. (They both squeal in expectation.)'
Great. (Goes to take the test.)'
Y\xc2\x92know what, you are mean boys, who are just being mean!'
Hey, don\xc2\x92t get mad at us! No one forced you to raise the stakes!'
That is not true. She did! She forced me!'
Hey, we would still be living here if hadn\xc2\x92t gotten the question\nwrong!'
Well it stupid, unfair question!'
Don\xc2\x92t blame the questions!'
Would you all stop yelling in our apartment! You are ruining moving\nday for us!'
Will you stop calling it your apartment!'
But it is our apartment!'
No it\xc2\x92s not!'
You guys! You guys! You\xc2\x92re gonna have a baby! They\xc2\x92re gonna\nhave a baby!'
MY SISTER\xc2\x92S GONNA HAVE MY BABY!!!!!!!'
Okay, but this can\xc2\x92t be good for the baby.'
Oh! (They stop hugging her to let her out and resume the hug without her.)'
I can\xc2\x92t find garbage bags!'
Oh, I think I saw some in here. '
What is it?!'
I don\xc2\x92t know! But maybe if we keep that drawer shut, it\xc2\x92ll\ndie.'
I can\xc2\x92t believe we\xc2\x92re living here!'
What?! What-what is it?!'
Did you see the size of the closets?!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe we live here!'
Awwwww!! (They lean back all the way.) Awwwwwww!!!'
